Solutions for Your Needs

Out of Cell Range?

Don't worry, SafetyLine still has you covered. All the smarts are in the back end so you're still safe; or connect your satellite device

One common concern when working alone is your ability to be able to Check-In or declare in areas with poor/spotty Cellular coverage, or complete lack of cellular coverage. SafetyLine is familiar with these situations and is able to offer several solutions. If you have only a cellular device, then you can change your usage protocols and check-in times to account for going in and out of cellular range. You can also even perform your check-ins from fixed location devices like landlines, payphones, or wifi hotspots. But if you are regularly working out of range, SafetyLine can integrate with various satellite solutions, like Sat phones or SPOT devices, to provide you will full coverage when out of range. You can even switch between your smartphone and your SPOT seamlessly as you go in and out of range. But even if you can’t get a signal, the nature of SafetyLine’s check-in system will ensure that an emergency signal is sent when your timer lapses, even if you’re out of range. Talk to one of our SafetyLine Solutions Consultants to help with your specific needs.

What about Higher Risk Situations?

Flexible check-in timers let you set a short interval for a quick response

The check-in system is great for day to day activities, but what about if you are doing something where you feel at higher risk? This might be as simple as climbing a tall ladder, to entering a building for the first time where you don’t know the dangers on the other side of the door. SafetyLine’s flexible check-in timers allows you to set shorter time intervals for check-ins, meaning that if you are in a higher risk situation, your timer will lapse and notification will be sent sooner. SafetyLine also even has a “High Risk Check-in” feature, where if a timer is set for a very short interval, then the system will not even wait for reminders if you miss your check-in, and instead declare a panic emergency on your behalf, should you get in distress.

Intrinsically Safe

SafetyLine can integrate with various IS certified devices

Do you work in an environment where you can’t carry a device which might spark? SafetyLine can still provide you with proper monitoring by integrating one of various certified intrinsically safe phone, data or satellite devices (ie. SPOT IS). Talk to one of our SafetyLine Solutions Consultants to help with your specific needs.

Concerned about your Privacy?

Don't worry, SafetyLine is only monitoring for Safety. You hold the control for monitoring, and you can shut it off at the end of shift. SafetyLine is only about keeping you safe!

Any time the word “monitoring” is discussed, there are bound to be concerns about privacy. SafetyLine is in fact a safety monitoring service, and does use modern technologies like GPS location. However SafetyLine is not about tracking or an employer keeping watch over every movement, it is about ensuring the safety of workers. All of the bits of technology used in the SafetyLine system are incorporated with that in mind, and each worker has the final control over what is or isn’t sent. Most of all, SafetyLine is a monitoring service for workers on the job; as soon as any worker logs off at the end of a shift, he or she is no longer monitored. SafetyLine’s technologies are about doing 3 things: detecting if a worker is in distress, letting the right people know about it, and providing them with the best information to send help and resolve the situation.
“It is a very reliable and cost effective means of being in compliance with the Occupational Health & Safety regulations. I would recommend the system to anyone who has workers who are working alone.”- Perry Walz (Husky Energy)

Work Alone Regulation Compliance

Proper implementation of SafetyLine will help make your organization compliant for Lone Worker regulations in any Province or Territory in Canada

At its core SafetyLine is designed to help Canadian companies meet Provincial regulations for working alone safety monitoring. If setup and used correctly and regularly, SafetyLine will help your organization be compliant, no matter what industry or province.

Need Consultation on your Work Alone Policies?

Not only do we provide technology, but we have experience with work alone programs on many levels. Part of the SafetyLine service is consultation to make the setup go smoothly

SafetyLine’s strength is partly in our technology service offering, however SafetyLine is meant as bigger part a complete solution to your work alone safety needs. We have years of experience implementing work alone safety programs, and our Solutions Consultants will not only help you determine the best configuration of SafetyLine for your organization and needs, but also provide consultation on your work alone program as a whole, including how to meet regulation compliance and how to provide the most effective and efficient monitoring program.

Getting your system setup and configured is part of our job, and making sure your staff are trained and comfortable makes for happy workers

We will work with you to ensure you have the best devices for each of your staff, working in the confines of your existing device policies

It is common for organizations to have a variety of devices, or device restrictions. SafetyLine’s Solutions Consultants will work with your team to ensure that you can get the best value from your existing devices, and ensure an easy integration with any new devices you wish to bring on. SafetyLine is also device ubiquitous so you may select any supported devices on any networks, and you won’t be locked in to purchasing purpose built hardware which will become out of date.
